definition: document folded in accordion form/to fold
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: I was teaching them some paper folding.
He is very clever with his hands and can make beautiful origami .
sentences.chinese: 他的手很巧，能做很漂亮的摺紙手工。

sentences.english: It was the first time that she saw people making paper ingot and people making scoop.
sentences.chinese: 第一次看到人們摺紙元寶，打鐵勺。

sentences.english: Tearing paper is different from ripping paper.
sentences.chinese: 簡單的撕紙和巧妙地摺紙是不同的。

sentences.english: Horses are more advanced origami models that are fun to create anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 馬是更先進的摺紙模型，建立地方很有趣。

sentences.english: My father had a nervous breakdown and cut my homework up to make paper dolls.
sentences.chinese: 我老爸有點神經失常，把作業剪裁開來摺紙玩偶了。

sentences.english: One idea for an origami wedding craft idea is to fold paper flowers to use as decorative pieces.
sentences.chinese: 一個用於婚禮摺紙工藝思想觀念是摺疊紙花作裝飾件。

sentences.english: Traditional origami keepsake box with four compartments.
sentences.chinese: 傳統的摺紙紀念品盒四格。

sentences.english: The ancient art of origami paper folding is a precise and delicate art form.
sentences.chinese: 古老的摺紙藝術是一種準確而精美的藝術形式。

sentences.english: Wood's technique bears similarities to origami.
sentences.chinese: 伍德所發明的技術與摺紙類似。

sentences.english: Thus to study the potential of the origami craft in the clothing market.
sentences.chinese: 進而探討摺紙工藝在服裝市場中的發展潛力。

definition: variant of 策劃|策划[ce4 hua4]
to come up with an idea/generation of ideas/inspiration
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
